channel.title: Purbanchal Directory - Recently Added Listings - Picnic Spot

item.title: Domukha / Mai Khola
item.description: Mai Khola, also named as TriyugaRiver, is one of the very famous rivers of Eastern Region in Nepal having both religious and historical importance. The river is originated from the great Kumbhakarna range passing through Ilam and reaching toJhapa where it is now established as a popular picnic spot. However, the river is very steep on the upper hilly region with longest hanging bridge belt, Jhapa being http://bossnepal.com/touring-the-terai/" title="Terai" style="background-color: transparent; border: 0px; margin: 0px; outline: 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; list-style: none; color: #0066cc;">Terai belt, the bed are flat due to which the speed of flowing water is less compared to hilly belts. Mai Khola is a big picnic spot, well organized with beautiful views giving immense pleasure to the ones visiting there. One can reach here fromDamak of Jhapa as it lay at the distance of 10 km ride to the east from
